alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, western McDowell, southeastern Mingo, south central Kanawha, northwestern Raleigh, Wyoming, eastern Logan, southwestern Fayette and eastern Boone Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Van to near Fedscreek. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Clintwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, John Flannagan Lake, Breaks Interstate, Davenport, Oak Hill, Oceana, Man, Van, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, Burnwell, Hinch, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Powellton, and Bald Knob. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 52 and 71. Route 19 between mile markers 16 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, southern and southeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Kanawha; Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming
